reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long day of travelling the AC Milano was a delight. the front desk gave us a brilliant dinner reservation and organised a taxi. Check in and check out were quick and efficient. Room was very clean, very quite and well equipped. Mimi bar was free. Right by tram stop or about 13 euros into the centre of Milan (I guess you could have walked in around 30 mins). Breakfast was simple but plentiful with plenty of topping up. Very close to our offices but I would stay there again on my own time.
reviews.title: Business Hotel. EOS.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was excellent,modern and clean and we found the location very convenient (we were using the metro). If we travel again to Milan, that;s the hotel we'll stay!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here first time. Hotel is newish and nice modern furnishing. Very helpful staff. Limited food options nearby. Not the greatest location, would not recommend for tourists. Nicely suited for business travel. Excellent breakfast buffet. For my purposes, I would stay again.
reviews.title: Nice accomodation but not great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel although very clean and modern is too far from city centre. The subway is around 10 minute walk away and at night, it can get pretty quiet. Corso Como is close by so at least there is some action there. Otherwise, I would stay somewhere closer to the centre. This hotel definitely is more suitable for conferences / business travellers. If you have an ipad or mobile device, the wireless internet charge is slightly cheaper than their regular rate. But still a hassle to have to pay for that separately.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but too far

reviews.text: Left Basel on Train to Milan. Train Station in Milan is a MAZE, but a Wonderful Experience to see the Massive Structure. The AC MILANO was just a Short Taxi Cab Ride to the Hotel from the Station. Very Pleasant Desk Greeting Staff met us. The Hotel was Super Contemporary, Very, Very Clean, Very Large Room. Hotel Breakfast was Excellent. The Location to us was very Excellent as when We stepped out of the Hotel Lobby,we walked right into the entry to the Metro Subway Service which to our surprise was very efficient. We Spent 3 Nights at this Wonderful Hotel. I would recomment it to anyone that needs a Very Clean, Comfortable, Concering Staff, Location, in Milano.Would stay there again without a DOUBT.
reviews.title: AC Milano in Milan an Excellent Choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Five Star Rating except for all the bells and whistles which we never use anyway unless we are just there to relax and enjoy the Pool,etc. We were on Vacation not on a SPA Makeover.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: Stylish and immaculate. Very good service and liked the free mini bar. Abundant breakfast included. Very modern and functional room. The area is in transition so be advised there is lots of construction. We ate at Fabbrica restaurant which was excellent and about a 5 minute walk (Pizza was great). We stayed between Xmas and New Years so we used points one night and the next days rate was only 120 Euros. Not certain how hotel operates (or charges) at capacity but overall impression was very good. Arrived at Garibaldi station. If you do not have many bags, it's a 5 minute walk as cab charged 8 Euros. Internet was very expensive, staff, excellent.
reviews.title: Why can't all Marriott Hotels be like the AC Milan?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is big, modern, clean and pretty much in the middle of nowhere, but we knew that when we booked it and expected that. It is however ridiculously close to an entrance to the metro and thus convenient for pretty much everything Milan has to offer. The rooms were very nice, but we did have an issue trying to get an extra robe delivered to the room, since there was only one there when we arrived. The highlight of our one night here was most definitely the breakfast which was all beautifully fresh and very very good. The juice selection was excellent, pastries were lovely, and the made to order hot drinks were all wonderful. Would have rates this hotel excellent if it wasn't for the little issue with the robe. Would definitely consider staying here again if I had any reason to go back to Milan.
reviews.title: Best breakfast we had during our Italy trip

reviews.text: it was my first time to stay at an AC Hotel. The experience was not bad but the hotel is not for fusspots who would not be very happy. This property in particular is one of the very fee high rise ones in Milan and is next to the Porta Garibaldi Station. In fact it is right next to an underground passage leading right under the rail platforms so for us it was perfect as we were leaving for Paris from the same station. Check in was swift and being a Platinum Elite card holder one of my rooms was upgraded to a suite. The decor and furnishings are modern style and the suite had a separate living room and a bedroom with a large bathroom having separate shower and a jacuzzi tub. Interestingly the soaps were football shaped ones - typical of AC Milano! The bathroom had toothbrushes, shavers along with anti fatigue creams and serums too. The minibar is complimentary and the free drinks were replenished at anytime if you ran out of the supplies. Buffer breakfast having hot and cold items was served for all free on the first floor. Internet access is not free but being Platinum Elite, I was given a voucher to use for an economy package and not the faster package. Nevertheless well appreciated as it was a 18 Euro voucher. The staff are so nice and helpful and nothing seemed difficult for them as it was their aim to make life easy and comfortable for the guests and they did an excellent job. There is a very good restaurant just next to the hotel called Grani & Braci which had fantastic Italian food at reasonable prices. I highly recommend this place. Although the location is a bit out of the city center but you could simply hop into tram 2 in front of the hotel and in 10 minutes you were in front of the Duomo. Also you can walk to the railway station through the passage and there you will find lots of shops, mini markets etc. Overall a very nice property and excellent staff. The only drawback is that the property does not have any connecting rooms at all which was an issue for me with my family.
reviews.title: 22€ for use of internet for 24h
